contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Salsa/Merengue Album

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Salsa/Merengue Album''' was first awarded in 2004. Before 2004 the awards for [[Grammy Award for Best Salsa Album|Best Salsa Album]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Merengue Album|Merengue Album]] were separate. A Tribute to José Alfredo Jiménez'' by [[Ismael Miranda]]<br>''Latin Songbird: Mi Alma y Corazón'' by [[La India|India]]<br>''Perseverancia'' by [[Tito Rojas]]<br>''Música Universal'' by [[Truco]] & Zaperoko<br>''Le Preguntaba a La Luna'' by [[Víctor Manuelle]]</small> |} ==See also== {{Portal|Latin American music}} *[[Grammy Award for Best Latin Pop Album]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Grammy Award For Best Salsa Merengue Album}} [[Category:Grammy Awards for Latin music]] [[Category:Salsa music]] [[Category:Merengue]]
